newsitem.title: ETHIOPIA: ATHLETICS-GEBRSELASSIE OUT OF WORLD CHAMPIONSHIPS.
newsitem.headline: ATHLETICS-GEBRSELASSIE OUT OF WORLD CHAMPIONSHIPS.

text.p: Ethiopia's Olympic 10,000 metres champion and world record holder Haile Gebrselassie said on Monday he would not participate in next month's world championships in Athens because the track was too hard.

"I completed the Atlanta Olympics 10,000 metres event suffering great injuries with blood flowing from my soles. It took me a long time to recover from that injury and I do not want to undergo similar sufferings," he said.
Gebrselassie said he decided to withdraw after hearing the Athens track was similar to the one used in Atlanta, which he said favoured sprinters at the expense of distance runners.

An Ethiopian Athletic Federation official said he was unaware of Gebrselassie's decision. "As far as we are concerned, Haile is among the 24 Ethiopian athletes selected for the Athens games and he is participating in training without fail," said the official.
Gebrselassie denied he was missing Athens to prepare for more lucrative grand prix events.
Ethiopia must now look to women runners like Gete Wami and Derartu Tulu for medals in Athens.
